dialogues.text: Film sets and rehearsal rooms are the coldest places on earth. He smiles as her car drives away. He wraps the scarf arou his neck and looks up and down the road again. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stand around in sullen discontent. OLIVIER paces back and forth with MILTON at his side. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should be on time, like everyone else. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a star. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a fucking star! He looks around in frustration. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we nip this behaviour in the bud perhaps it won't be repeated. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Marilyn you're talking about. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER scowls at COLIN, who gives him a cigarette. MARIL finally emerges with PAULA at her elbow. OLIVIER advances on her, his anger simmering. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn, darling you are an angel, and I kiss the hem of your garment, but why can't you get here on time for the love of fuck? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... you have that word in England too? She looks at him in surprise. She looks sedated, not quit there. PAULA leaps protectively to her defence. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn has to prepare properly. She has to find in herself all that lies under the surface. Acting isn't just a case of putting on a costume or some ludicrous false nose. OLIVIER gives her a freezing look then takes Marilyn's hand, leading her forward like a child. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must apologise to Dame Sybil. MARILYN reddens with humiliation as he takes her arm. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER propels MARILYN towards SYBIL THORNDIKE. MARILYN reddens with humiliation. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... SYBIL THORNDIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cutting her off) My dear, you mustn't concern yourself. A great actress like you has many other things on her mind. A radiant smile spreads slowly across Marilyn's face as t older woman's words sink in. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a great actress? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 48.  SYBIL THORNDIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the rest of us truly know how to act for the camera. But you do. It is a rare gift. She looks sharply at OLIVIER. SYBIL THORNDIKE (cont'd) This poor girl hasn't had your years of experience. She is in a strange country, acting a strange part. Now, are you helping or bullying? OLIVIER looks aghast at being so roundly rebuked. COLIN looks on, startled. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER, MILTON, PERCEVAL, ORTON and the editor JACK HARR watch rushes. COLIN lurks about unnoticed at the back. Th watch one of OLIVIER's speeches (from the " The Coconut Girl" sequence we saw filming in Scenes 61 and 62). He is dry and clipped, every take precise and professional. It an effective but theatrical performance. MARILYN sneaks in with ARTHUR MILLER. They sit in the bac row watching her performance from the same scene. She fluffs take after take, gets her words wrong and pauses, looking dazed. COLIN notices her clutching MILLER's hand tightly. But finally a good take comes up. She is charmin and natural and her performance suddenly makes OLIVIER's look stiff and clumsy. MILLER smiles in relief and reassurance. MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one's pretty damn good. You knocked it out of the park. MARILYN glows at his praise. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Marilyn gets it right you just don't want to look at anyone else. OLIVIER frowns. For all his greatness as an actor he will never be a film star like the maddeningly instinctive Marilyn. And the injustice of it is like a stab through h heart. At the back COLIN only has eyes for the screen. He watche MARILYN's image, enthralled. Until now he has taken Maril entirely at Olivier's valuation, but as he watches her on screen he begins to see things differently. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sneaks a look at her in real life. She is holding MILLER's hand tightly, looking tense and vulnerable as on disastrous take follows another. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN comes out of the viewing theatre behind OLIVIER and MILTON. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only been shooting for four days and we're already two weeks behind. COLIN can't resist blurting out a comment. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not only show her the good takes? Then she might feel better about herself. He looks self-conscious as they both turn to stare at him MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's right. She could use the confidence. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it's traditional for the producer of the film to watch rushes. Besides, she's an experienced actress. She should learn from her mistakes. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just upset her. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not half as much as they upset me. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN hurries across the stage, carrying a fresh carton o "Oliviers". ORTON stops him. ORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do that. You go and find Marilyn's script. She thinks she left it in her dressing room. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: COLIN bursts into the dressing room without knocking. Clothes are strewn carelessly all over the floor. There a pill bottles, full and empty, on every surface, along wit empty bottles of champagne and bunches of flowers. COLIN rummages around on the table, moving piles of scripts and books. No luck. He walks casually through the half-open door into the inner chamber. And stops dead in his tracks. MARILYN stands by a chair, a towel wrapped around her hea She is completely naked. She looks at him in astonishment. He stares back, equally astounded. He sees her script, heavily covered in handwritten notes, lying on the table next to an open bottle of champagne an a bottle of pills. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your script... MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it. Calmly she takes the towel from her hair and wraps it around herself. She smiles quizzically. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go now, Colin. He hesitates a beat, surprised that she knows his name, before he fumbles for the door. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: ROOM/CORRIDOR. DAY.
dialogues.text: COLIN slams the door, aghast. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and LUCY are buried in the clothes racks kissing passionately. They surface for air. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David wants to know if you're ready for the extras in the ballroom scene. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 51.  LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him he can start sending them up. Women first. They kiss again. He pulls away. LUCY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to Saturday. He looks at her uncertainly. LUCY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our date? COLIN (AWKWARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot. I can't do Saturday. Marilyn wants to go shopping. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you work for her? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry asked me to help out. She smiles sardonically, teasing him, but a little hurt. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course you must do what Larry says. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Friday instead? She shrugs in agreement. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick you up. Eight o'clock. He smiles, a little too glibly, and hurries away. LUCY gazes after him. He doesn't look back. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN sits in the front with ROGER driving. MARILYN, ARTH MILLER and MILTON GREENE sit in the back. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very quiet in the normally busy West End. Shops hav begun shutting after lunch and the city is rapidly emptying. SHOPPERS wander past, taking little notice of MARILYN who has her hair covered in a scarf and wears dar glasses. MILLER walks at her side, holding her hand. She glances at MILTON with an awkward laugh. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 52.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, it's quiet. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Saturday. Early closing. But they're expecting us. She stops to window shop. MILTON lowers his voice to COLI MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's recognised her. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least she can shop in peace. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn's a star. Stars don't even pee alone. He looks around anxiously. But then a PASSER-BY suddenly narrows his eyes and takes a second look. His face lights up and he shouts - PASSER-BY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Marilyn Monroe! MARILYN gives him a radiant smile and within seconds is surrounded by a crowd of SHOPPERS alerted by the fuss. A feverish excitement grows out of nothing as people come running to look, pushing and shoving to see. MARILYN is quickly hemmed in by the heaving mob. To begin with she enjoys it, smiling and posing happily for the cameras that appear out of nowhere. But as the crowd pres towards something in the mood of the gathering changes; i becomes wild and over-excited mood as people scream Marilyn's name and shove bits of paper to sign in her fac A WOMAN is pushed to the ground and MARILYN is forced bac against the shop window. COLIN sees a flicker of panic on her face. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, she'll be torn apart... MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out of here. COLIN and ROGER hurl themselves into the crowd doing what they can to keep the excited fans at bay. They manage to force a path to the car, drag the door ope and bundle MARILYN and MILLER into the back. MARILYN is pinned against the door and COLIN has to put his arm arou her shoulders as he helps her in. He hurls himself into t front, with Milton running alongside the moving car to di in beside Marilyn. People run alongside, hammering wildly on the windows in violent hysteria. MILTON does his best to put a cheerful gloss on the chaos MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 53.  MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Marilyn, they really fucking love you. As COLIN looks in the rear-view mirror he sees MILLER sha his head in dazed horror as MARILYN slumps half-collapsed into the seat beside him. MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madness. Someone's going to get hurt. COLIN shifts his gaze to her in the mirror and his eyes meet Marilyn's. He sees - or imagines - a terrible sadnes before she quickly replaces her dark glasses. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN stands silently by the camera, watching MARILYN and RICHARD WATTIS, in character as Elsie Marina and Northbrook, open the doors of the Grand Duke's drawing room.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it? OLIVIER looks out from behind the camera, patient and charming. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. The line is "Gee, this is all right too, isn't it". It's a tiny word, my darling, but it matters. Let's go straight away. MARILYN smiles vaguely. HAIR and MAKE-UP rush to do last minute checks. DENYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera running. SOUNDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed. DENYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark it. The clapperboard clatters down. Take two. WATTIS and MARILYN come in again on their cue.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?" MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 54.  OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. Nearly there, but Terry did work so very hard on this and we must try to get it right for him. Straight away, please. Take three.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "Well, we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is... all right, isn't it?" By now there is a panic-stricken edge to her voice. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just drop it? OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is that you have already admired the downstairs hall in an earlier scene. Now you are admiring this room as well. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. (Pause, she looks stricken) Paula! OLIVIER looks startled. PAULA comes scurrying across. MARILYN appeals to her, turning away from OLIVIER. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. He's such a strange man. I think she'd figure out he only invited her to sleep with her. PAULA (TO OLIVIER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason Marilyn can't remember the line is because she doesn't believe the situation her character is in. OLIVIER takes out all his pent-up frustration on PAULA. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she should pretend to believe it. PAULA bristles at this insult to her husband's work. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend? We're talking about the difference between the truth and artificial crap. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 54A.  OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in absolute agreement, Paula. Acting is all about sincerity. And if you can fake that, you're off to the races. PAULA only stares at him in disgust. Thoroughly alarmed, MILTON intervenes. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 55.  MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should try for another take. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn needs time to give a great performance. You should give her as long as it takes. Chaplin took eight months to make a movie. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight months of this? I'd rather kill myself. Throughout all this MARILYN herself looks lost. COLIN watches her as she feels the crew's irritable collective gaze. Flustered, she flutters her hands in a calming gesture, then goes to the side of the set to lean on a ba put there for her to rest on (her costume is too tight to allow her to sit down). PAULA accompanies her. MARILYN looks up at her in anguish. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. I can't. PAULA looks at her adamantly. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it. You can't fail. You will have more pain, you will suffer more but you will create. All you need is time. MARILYN looks at her, desperately wanting to believe it. PAULA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Marilyn, a tree is never just a tree. What kind of tree is Elsie? An elm tree? A birch tree? OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Under his breath to COLIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God knows, but I'm a weeping fucking willow. PAULA (TO MARILYN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about the things you like, instead of him. Frank Sinatra. Coca Cola. Be specific. The character comes alive if you know what you're doing. MARILYN listens intently, a frown flitting across her fac She goes back to her mark. The whole crew is on tenterhooks. Camera running, speed, mark it... Action! Take four. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 56.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?" OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. A look of near-panic creeps into Marilyn's eyes at her inability to remember the line. CUT TO:  78 DELETED 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clapperboard snaps one final time. Take twenty three. MARILYN's smile is a grimace of terror. COLIN can hardly bear to look. Everyone holds their breath.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? (Pause) Gee, this is all right too, isn't it?" There is a stunned moment. WATTIS gapes and MARILYN looks around uncertainly. Did she say it? OLIVIER gestures frantically from behind the camera that she should carry on. She hesitates... ... there is an agonising beat... ... and then she panics and bolts for the side of the set MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula! OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. What's the matter now? He takes her arm and whisks her away to the side of the set, lowering his voice, trying to conceal his exasperati with a honeyed tone. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Marilyn. This is my failure, not yours. Tell me how I can help you. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who Elsie is. I can't act her if I don't know who she is! MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 57.  OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsie is all in the script MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find her. She's not there. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have her precisely, you know her inside out. I'm in awe of your gift. We all are. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not real. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not simply rely on your natural talents? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying I don't need to act? OLIVIER is bewildered by her inability to appreciate her own natural talent - as he sees it. He looks at her in genuine anguish. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn, you are the most attractive woman in the world. I'm simply suggesting you be yourself. MARILYN (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be myself! (Pause) I want to be an actress playing a character. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Trying to be helpful) All you have to do, dear Marilyn, is be sexy. Isn't that what you do? MARILYN flinches as though slapped. Tension ripples throu the set. COLIN watches in dismay. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Lee. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already got Paula, for heaven's sake. I'm the director. Speak to me. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am only Lee's representative. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's five in the morning in New York. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 57A.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her furious scream brings all activity to a halt. She sto off the set with PAULA following. The atmosphere is awful

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: OLIVIER sits brooding savagely in front of his make-up mirror with MILTON GREENE. COLIN unobtrusively fetches whisky and cigarettes for them both as OLIVIER abruptly booms out to himself. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "O, now, for ever Farewell the tranquil mind/Farewell content/ Farewell the plumed troop and the big wars/That make ambition virtue O, farewell/Farewell..." (Pause, exasperated) Paula's not an actress. She not a director, not a teacher. Her only talent is buttering up Marilyn. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be worse if she wasn't around. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what would make Marilyn Monroe a real actor? A season in rep. They wouldn't stand for this kind of nonsense at the Hippodrome in Eastbourne. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be patient with her. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to teach Marilyn how to act is like teaching Urdu to a badger. MILTON gives him a look but says nothing. Instead he pick up his bag and opens it. It is stuffed with bottles of pills. He takes one of them, checks the label and puts it in his pocket. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go see her. She'll need something to help her calm down. COLIN holds the door for him as he goes out. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) Pills to sleep, pills to wake up. Pills to calm her down, pills to give her energy. No wonder she's permanently ten feet underwater. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN looks at him tentatively. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's scared. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all scared. It's part of being an actor. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have the training to deal with it. OLIVIER turns from the mirror to survey him. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't buy the little girl lost act if I were you. Though heaven knows it's tempting. He sighs wistfully. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think Marilyn knows exactly what she's doing. COLIN isn't so sure but wisely holds his tongue. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get over to Parkside and make sure the poor girl's all right. (Pause) And Colin? Don't forget who you work for. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN draws up outside Marilyn's house. The place is dark and quiet. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER takes two bottles of beer from the well stocked drinks cabinet and hands one to COLIN, putting a coaster for him on the coffee table. COLIN looks around the opule drawing room. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure they won't mind? ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself. They can spare it. (Pause) Marilyn's okay. She's taken some pills and gone to bed. He frowns darkly. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 60.  ROGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They like to keep her doped up. It makes her easier to control. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Miller? ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shakes his head) The others. They're terrified their cash cow will slip away. He smiles grimly and raises his beer bottle. ROGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN wakes abruptly from a doze as his empty bottle of beer rolls to the floor. ROGER is fast asleep. COLIN glances at the clock. It is nearly midnight. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN, a little drunk, creeps out of the toilet. The narr strip of light from the door disappears, leaving the hall in darkness. COLIN inches forward uncertainly. He stops, waiting for his eyes to adjust. The house is totally silent. Then, just as he is about to move, he hea something. Breathing, very close by. Faint but unmistakable. Shallow breaths, like sighs. COLIN is paralysed. A beat, then - A door is flung open along the hall and light floods into the corridor. MARILYN is sitting on the carpet leaning against the wall only a few feet away from Colin. She is wrapped in a pink bed-cover and stares directly at him, her expression blan and sedated. By her side is an open spiral bound notebook its pages closely crammed with handwriting. MILLER (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn. Come back to bed. It's not what you think. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at COLIN. It is not even clear she knows he is there. COLIN gazes back at her, paralysed. MILLER's voice comes again, flat and tired. MILLER (CONT'D) (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a few ideas. Writer's stuff. (Pause) Bring back my book and let's get some sleep. Finally MARILYN stirs and closes the notebook. Holding it to her breast and clutching the cover around her shoulder she gets up and goes into the bedroom, closing the door. As the light snaps off COLIN breathes for the first time what feels like minutes. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN, muffled in his scarf, looks up as Marilyn's car cruises to a halt at the gate. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Miss Monroe. She is hunched in the back, her hair in a scarf, her face protected by her large sunglasses with PAULA by her side. She doesn't look up. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER, DAVID ORTON and COLIN huddle around the camera. JEREMY SPENSER and TECHNICIANS stand around, bored and listless. MILTON appears. They speak in low, urgent tones OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nearly lunch time. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't feeling the part. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a light comedy. How much feeling can it possibly require? MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her a few minutes... OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't hide in her bloody dressing room all day. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes she can. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER looks at him angrily. He is close to the end of h tether. OLIVIER (TO COLIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and find out what the hell's going on.

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: COLIN knocks softly on the dressing room door. PAULA appears, opening it no more than a crack. She looks out suspiciously, sees it is Colin and turns back into the room. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Colin. COLIN waits a moment then PAULA opens the door wider. PAULA (CONT'D) (cont'd) Come in. Marilyn wants to see you. COLIN stares at her in surprise. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: COLIN comes in. The dressing room is in semi-darkness. PAULA settles down in the corner. MARILYN lies on a sofa, wearing a bathrobe, her face in shadow. Pill bottles are scattered across the dresser at her elbow. There is a lon pause. She sighs softly. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24. (Pause) Nearly MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remind us of the young king in the movie. Kind of honest and innocent. COLIN (WOUNDED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not innocent. She turns her head and her beautiful face comes fully int the light. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your job on this picture? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 62A.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the third assistant director. Just a gopher really. Go for this, go for that... MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Larry's assistant too. He shrugs awkwardly. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in my house last night? Did he send you? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN hesitates. It seems pointless to deny it. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was worried about you. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you spying on me? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Of course not. Why would anyone spy on you? She sighs, and looks away. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Miss Monroe? He waits hesitantly, but she seems to have drifted off. B then, suddenly, she turns back to him, her eyes huge. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin? Whose side are you on? COLIN stares at her. She looks utterly beautiful and vulnerable in the shadowy light. There is only one answer anyone could give. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours, Miss Monroe. She rewards him with a brilliant smile, her whole face lighting up. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Marilyn. He is suddenly overwhelmed by a rush of sympathy. She loo so lost and vulnerable. Perhaps he means it. Perhaps he i on her side now. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As COLIN walks down through the studio he meets RICHARD WATTIS with PAUL HARDWICK, on their way to wardrobe. WATT winks at him. WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn's got a new boyfriend. Larry will get jealous. HARDWICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say that again. He gives a camp laugh. COLIN tries to shrug it off with a lightness he doesn't feel. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 63A.  WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in there for ten minutes at least. Plenty of time for a kiss and a cuddle. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 64.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula was with us the whole time. WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mind boggles, dear. COLIN smiles but his expression freezes as he looks up to see LUCY nearby. She has heard every word of the exchange CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN is finally back on the set, filming a solo dance routine. Released from the need to remember any words she takes refuge in the physical activity, undulating sexily her tight white dress in a performance which is gawky, mildly silly and charming all at the same time. The dance is deliberately a little amateurish. Elsie Mari isn't meant to be any sort of superstar. But she radiates joy and innocence and sheer happiness in the dance, and MARILYN captures all this perfectly. Within the scene the actor JEREMY SPENSER, playing Nicky, watches from the doorway. Everyone watches silently from behind the camera. No one can look away, least of all COLIN. It feels like one pure joyful moment in the agony the film has become, and Maril is radiant. Even OLIVIER has a reluctant half-smile on hi face as he watches. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stage is empty except for OLIVIER and MILLER. They si in a pool of light in the cavernous room. COLIN pours whisky for them and then steps back into the shadows. Bot men ignore him. He is too unimportant to worry about. MILLER leans forward, holding his pipe but not smoking it MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamed last night I could hear singing. And then I realised it wasn't a dream. There was a male voice choir serenading Marilyn under our window. At two in the morning. It's a circus. A freak show. OLIVIER smiles but MILLER looks dazed. MILLER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to New York for a few days. I need to see my kids. I need a break. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 65.  OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't help Marilyn. MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a moment) I can't help her. (Pause) You know what she loves to do most? Sleep. It's what she lives for. Sleep is her demon. He pauses for a second. MILLER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've disappointed her. OLIVIER looks at him. MILLER shakes his head. MILLER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thought I could smash all her insecurities with one magical stroke. That I could make her a new person. He pauses for a second, weighing every word carefully. MILLER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants me to protect her but I can't. I can't even protect myself. (Pause) She read some notes I made. They were nothing. Just a few ideas. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About her? He looks up and nods slowly. MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took them the wrong way. He leaves a long, uneasy pause. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you do love her? Your new bride and all that? MILLER plays with his whisky. MILLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't work. I can't think. (Pause) She's devouring me. Forgotten in the shadows, COLIN listens attentively to every word. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning. COLIN sees Olivier's black Bentley cruisin towards the gate. VIVIEN LEIGH sits in the back seat. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Colin darling. You look like Horatio defending the bridge. Are you going to let me in? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIVIEN is doing what amounts to a royal tour. She greets everyone, from the lowest chippie to the Heads of Department with the same flirtatious grace. OLIVIER walks at her elbow. The crew crowd around her. She is easy and relaxed, relishing every second of their attention. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope Larry isn't making you all work too hard. I know what a dreadful slave driver he can be. She sees ORTON and takes his hands. VIVIEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, he would be lost without you. ORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doing my job. Tough as he is, he melts visibly. She moves on to JACK CARDIFF, the lighting cameraman, looking at him in mock misery. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting old, Jack. I need you to work your miracles on me. CARDIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're more beautiful every year, Vivien. She laughs and turns to COLIN, looking at him severely. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you are looking after Larry like I told you? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing my best... VIVIEN glances away to see MARILYN standing nearby, awkwa and excluded. She has come straight from make-up and wear only a towelling robe, slippers and curlers in her hair. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compared to VIVIEN she looks frumpish. VIVIEN glides towards her, hands extended. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling Marilyn! She kisses her on both cheeks and holds her hands. VIVIEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry tells me you are quite, quite superb. I'm wild with jealousy. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but everyone says you were a wonderful Elsie on stage. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm too old to play her in the film. Larry was quite brutal about that. You see, the truth is all that matters to him. That's why we all admire him so very much. She glances at OLIVIER with a fluttering laugh. He smiles back with a haunted look in his eyes. VIVIEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I must let you work. I only came to wish you good luck! Goodbye, everyone! The crew press around her. MARILYN watches, feeling more than ever the odd one out. COLIN watches her from the edg of the crowd. She cuts a lonely, vulnerable figure. He is totally preoccupied with her, so much so that when VIVIEN comes up behind him he turns guiltily as though caught ou VIVIEN stares at him. All her exuberance has vanished and she looks suddenly tired and older. It as though the faca of a beautiful building is beginning to crack. She gazes him with bitter disappointment. VIVIEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Colin. Not you too. He wants to protest but VIVIEN is already turning away. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH. DAY.
dialogues.text: COLIN pushes open the door to the projection booth. The screen is lit up with the rushes of the scene in The Prin And The Showgirl where a startlingly beautiful MARILYN, i gorgeous close-up, eats caviar and drinks champagne in a toast to the American President. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER and VIVIEN stand in the shadows of the projector beam. COLIN freezes in the doorway to the projection boot holding a pile of film cans. VIVIEN is crying abjectly. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think she would be so beautiful. She... shines on that screen. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't upset yourself. You are ten times the actress she will ever be. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could see yourself. The way you watch her... OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's never been anything between Marilyn and me. She laughs hysterically. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only because she didn't want you. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're imagining things. VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm a fool? You didn't think the little tart could resist the great Laurence Olivier. She looks at him venomously, a dangerous, unbalanced hatr seething in her expression. VIVIEN (CONT'D) (cont'd) But she saw through you, didn't she darling? Take away the actor and what's left of the man? You can't even play the husband properly without a script. (slaps him hard across the face. ) I hope she makes your life hell! OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivien..! She storms out. After a beat, COLIN tentatively enters. OLIVIER looks at COLIN in muted apology. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 69.  OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't been well. There was a baby... she... we... lost it... COLIN looks down awkwardly. OLIVIER sighs. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a pause) Do you have a cigarette, Colin? COLIN hurries to offer him one of his "Oliviers". OLIVIER grimaces wryly. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one of those awful things. COLIN finds a woodbine in his other pocket and gives it t OLIVIER, who lights it with a shaking hand. He inhales deeply. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivien's right... I did think I would fall shatteringly in love with Marilyn. What a joke. He looks at COLIN, his feelings raw and exposed. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, boy, when it comes to women you are never too old for humiliation. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set is dressed and the crew are waiting but once agai there is no sign of Marilyn. The actors, RICHARD WATTIS a PAUL HARDWICK amongst them, sit apathetically in full costume, while ORTON stands with his arms folded. Technicians chat or sit idly. As COLIN watches, OLIVIER looks across at MILTON who shrugs hopelessly. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: ROOM/PARKSIDE. DAY.
dialogues.text: COLIN pours whisky for OLIVIER. MILTON comes in. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn won't shoot today. She's gone back to Parkside. She's upset about Arthur leaving England. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only going to visit his children. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 70.  MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't leave Marilyn alone. She can't handle it. She thinks everyone's going to abandon her. The phone rings. OLIVIER picks with a sudden burst of optimism. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps she's come back. (Into the phone) Yes? ROGER (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Laurence? It's Roger. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Roger. What's up? ROGER (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Colin there, Sir? He frowns and looks at COLIN in bewilderment. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's here. (Pause) It's for you. Puzzled, COLIN takes the phone as OLIVIER stares at him. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger? CUT TO PARKSIDE, where, to Colin's astonishment MARILYN c on the line (Roger is not in shot). MARILYN (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin, why don't you drop by here on your way home? CUT BACK TO PINEWOOD - MILTON recognises Marilyn's voice instantly. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck? OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Marilyn on the phone to my third fucking assistant? COLIN looks around helplessly. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure I can do that. CUT TO PARKSIDE. MARILYN smiles. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 70A.  MARILYN (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Don't tell anyone though. She hangs up. CUT TO PINEWOOD: COLIN replaces the phone in its cradle. MILTON and OLIVIER stare at him. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What did she want? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to see me. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs awkwardly. MILTON looks at OLIVIER in panic. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shouldn't be talking to her. He's just a kid. Supposing he says something? (Pause) Why the hell didn't she call me? His angry - and jealous - frustration is in stark contras to OLIVIER, who looks at COLIN with a new interest, wondering if there is anything in this odd situation that can work to his advantage. He smiles calmly. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Colin knows what he's doing. Don't you, Colin? There is a warning as well as approval in his tone. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER leads COLIN into the formal drawing room. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Monroe said for you to wait. She won't be long. He looks at COLIN dubiously as he goes out. COLIN is nervous and not quite sure what to do with himself. He looks at the drinks in their decanters on the sideboard a is suddenly desperate for some Dutch courage. He finds th brandy and picks it up - MARILYN (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself to a drink. COLIN wheels in surprise. MARILYN stands in the doorway, casually but beautifully dressed in silk trousers and a pale cream shirt. COLIN looks guiltily at the brandy. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just... checking you've got everything you need. She walks to the sideboard, standing only a few inches aw from him. He can't take his eyes from hers. He drops his gaze, only to find himself staring at her breasts. He loo up again sharply but not before she notices. She takes th decanter from his hand. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me. She pours some brandy into a glass and gives it to him. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you frightened of me, Colin? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 72.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Because I like you. Colin doesn't know what to say. MARILYN gazes at him. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to help me. Will you do that? She looks at him, her eyes wide. COLIN feels himself sinking into her gaze. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only the third. Just a messenger, really. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what's going on. You can see both sides of the situation. He shrugs in helpless agreement. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be honest. Tell me everything. She indicates a chair and COLIN perches on it awkwardly. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. I thought you weren't scared of me. (Pause) Are you hungry? I'll have them send in a tray. I'm starved. He doesn't know how to reply and Marilyn misreads his silence. Her eyes widen in dismay. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, gee, I'm sorry. Am I interrupting something? Maybe you have a Mrs. Colin waiting for you at home? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no Mrs. Colin. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can talk as long as we like? He nods uncertainly. She frowns. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Sir Olivier so mean? He talks to me as if he's slumming. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN hesitates then decides to throw caution to the wind COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's wrong. It's agony for him because he's a great actor who wants to be a film star, and agony for you because you're a film star who wants to be a great actress. And this film won't help either of you. He stops, breathless, knowing he has gone to far. She stares at him, wide-eyed with surprise. Horribly self- conscious he takes a too large swig of his brandy, redden and coughs. She laughs. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you can handle that? You don't look old enough to drink. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm 23, Miss Monroe. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Marilyn. (Pause) I'm 30. I guess that makes me an old lady to you. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years is nothing. She smiles then sits opposite him. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know I've been married three times already? How did that happen? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just looking for the right man. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always look right at the start. She smiles wistfully. Her presence is overwhelming. The silence stretches for a second, pregnant with strange possibilities. Suddenly the phone rings, making him jump. Automatically he picks it up. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON sits at his desk. He leans forward anxiously at th sound of Colin's voice. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin? Is everything okay? What did she want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN looks at MARILYN and hesitates. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Miss Monroe just had... some large packages she needed handling... He looks at MARILYN's voluptuous figure. MARILYN looks ba innocently and mouths the word "packages". She giggles. H turns crimson with the effort of trying to suppress his o laughter but MARILYN isn't helping. She teasingly makes shapes in the air of just how large the packages might be He covers the phone, agonised, before they both collapse irrepressible laughter. COLIN finally pulls himself together. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Milton? There is a long silence at the other end of the line. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON turns pale. When he speaks again his anger is just barely under control. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me speak to her, Colin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN offers the phone to MARILYN but she shakes her head COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's tied up right now. This only sets MARILYN off again. She howls with laughter COLIN can't help joining her. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON stares at the phone in disbelief. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Colin! (Shouts) Let me talk to her, damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN looks at MARILYN but she shakes her head between giggles. He turns back to the phone, barely able to get t words out between snorts of laughter. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Milton. I have to go. He hangs up quickly. They both laugh helplessly. MARILYN smiles. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's walk in the garden. See if we can find any more reporters in the bushes. She giggles. COLIN's heart contracts as she casually take his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a golden glow on the horizon as the sun sinks. MARILYN, a cardigan around her shoulders, walks along the path. COLIN is at her side, acutely aware of her physical closeness. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was so pretty out here. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get out more. See the sights. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the sights. She giggles again, her mood lighter. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us. We're just like Elsie and the young King. What would Sir Laurence say if he could see us now? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he'd mind. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN grows reflective. She takes COLIN's arm in a friendly way as they walk. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to be an artist. To grow as an actor. I was so proud to be working with the great Olivier. (Pause) Now he thinks I'm the enemy. She looks at him innocently. COLIN hesitates. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't understand your kind of actor. He's hated the method ever since Vivien worked with Elia Kazan. It's all too new and strange. You're the future, and it frightens him. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time I walk into the studio I feel this sense of doom come over me. He looks at me like he's smelling a pile of rotten fish. And the crew hate me. Paula is the only person I can trust. (Pause) Except for you now, maybe. She looks at him, her eyes huge. COLIN feels his senses swim as he stares into them... ... and then ROGER suddenly appears on the steps. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone call for you, Miss Monroe. It's Mr. Miller. MARILYN goes back up the path towards the house, glancing back briefly at Colin. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Colin. Thanks for telling me the truth. COLIN stares after her. It is a second before he realises that ROGER is gazing at him sternly. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be leaving now, I expect. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: The next morning. COLIN walks in as OLIVIER is talking to MILTON. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 76A.  OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if he fucks her sideways. Perhaps it'll calm her down. (Pause) Oh, hello, boy. He smiles cheerfully. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 77.  OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you spent last night with Marilyn. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't spend the night with her. We just had a chat. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard them chuckling. OLIVIER offers COLIN a lewdly suggestive grin. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps if Colin is very diplomatic Marilyn is more likely to behave herself. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just wants a chum, that's all. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chum? Jesus Christ, what is this, Goodbye Mr. Chips? Grow up, kid. He barges out of the room, slamming the door behind him. OLIVIER checks the effect of his Grand Duke in the mirror and sighs abruptly. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought working with Marilyn would make me feel young again. But I look dead in the rushes. Dead behind the eyes. He gazes at himself thoughtfully. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I'm angry with her because in my heart I know my own career is in a terrible rut. I wanted to renew myself through her but all I see reflected in that magnificent face is my own inadequacy. He leans back. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I admire Marilyn. I really do. Despite her behaviour. She has taken everything Hollywood can throw at her and triumphed. COLIN waits, uncertain why OLIVIER is confiding in him. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 78.  OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An actress has to be pretty tough to get even a tenth as far as she has. He glances up at COLIN in the mirror, shrewd and sympathetic. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But be careful, boy. She doesn't need to be rescued. Not really. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gossip is always fast to travel but on a film it goes at the speed of light. As COLIN arrives on the set he is greeted with wolf whistles and jeers by RICHARD WATTIS, PAUL HARDWICK and the crew. SOUNDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was Marilyn like then, Col? HARDWICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going over her lines with her, were you? SOUNDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will she be in today or is she too tired? It is all good-natured stuff but COLIN feels strangely protective, not so much on his own behalf as Marilyn's. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was just being friendly. WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet. There are hoots of laughter. COLIN retreats to a corner only to find RICHARD WATTIS pursuing him. WATTIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever heard of the Venus Fly Trap? There you are, Colin the innocent little fly buzzing about happily, when suddenly a heavenly scent attracts you and - Snap! COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck off, Dickie. You've never slept with a woman in your life. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 79.  WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a Femme Fatale when I see one, love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brief hiatus in filming. COLIN looks on uneasily as MARILYN, resting against her lean-to, has her costume attended to by LUCY. ORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes, ladies and gents. Three minutes. It has just dawned on COLIN that he has missed his date with LUCY. Before he can react he is jerked violently behind the scenery and pushed up against the wall by an angry MILTON. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur Miller called me. He's not happy with you. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even know who I am. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn must have said something. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she was trying to make him jealous... ORTON turns around frowning furiously at the voices behin the set. MILTON pushes COLIN off the set ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON turns bitterly on Colin as soon as they are outsid the studio door. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kid, I've known Marilyn for seven years. I fell in love with her, just like you've done. COLIN is about to protest but MILTON ignores him. MILTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had ten days together and that was it. She picked me up, she put me down. That's what she does. She breaks hearts. She'll break yours. My advice to you is to quit before you get burned. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your advice. And I'm not in love with her. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 80.  MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, have it your way. (Pause) You don't see Marilyn again, you don't even talk to her. She is completely off-limits to you. Got it? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN hurries along the corridor, looking for LUCY, who h sees pushing a rack of clothes. He stops awkwardly. She gazes at him meaningfully, hurt and puzzled. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited for you on Friday. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... I'm sorry... I forgot... I've just been so busy. LUCY (SHARP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hear. COLIN (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how crews gossip. There's nothing in it. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course there isn't. Marilyn Monroe fancying you? Come on. COLIN is put out. Up to now he has never fully confronted the possibility of Marilyn wanting him, but he doesn't li the idea being dismissed so lightly. Lucy sees it and her eyes widen in surprise and hurt. Before she can respond MARILYN herself coming towards the in her gown, her hair up in towel, surrounded by PAULA an her MAKE-UP people. She offers him a dazzling smile. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Colin. COLIN smiles, self-conscious. MARILYN stops and frowns, looking at Lucy. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you guys dating? That's what I heard. She looks at him expectantly and suddenly his growing fantasy that she might actually be interested in him kick in hard. He shrugs casually. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 81.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. You know how crews like to gossip. His voice trails off lamely as he realises he is repeatin what he has just said to Lucy. MARILYN smiles. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. You look cute together. She walks off with her retinue. There is a long pause. COLIN looks up to see LUCY staring at him in dismay. Ther are sudden tears in her eyes, which she wipes away angril LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were different. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, I really like you. We've had such fun... LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's time to set your sights a little higher. I get it. (Pause) Who do you think you are, Cary Grant? She shoves the rack of clothes back towards the wardrobe department. Part of him knows he should go after her, but the end he just stays where he is. He can't help feeling unworthy sense of relief. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN crosses to the mean little bed on its iron frame an collapses on it gratefully. The noise of the rowdy pub fl up through the floorboards. He covers his ears with his h then folds the pillow over his head in a desperate attemp block it out. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The studio is quiet at the weekend. COLIN walks along, snatching a moment for a cigarette. As he reaches the doo to the editing suites a battered old Wolsey draws up besi him. ROGER SMITH is at the wheel. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. COLIN looks at him in confusion. The studio doors open an MILTON emerges. He glances darkly at COLIN and ROGER. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any problem, Roger? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 82.  ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just dropped by to take Colin out to lunch. COLIN looks surprised. MILTON notices. COLIN stubs out hi cigarette and hurries to the passenger door. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not taking him to Marilyn? That would drop us all in a whole ocean of shit. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, sir. MILTON sees a bulky blanket on the back seat. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in there? ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a picnic. We've been looking forward to it, haven't we, Colin? COLIN looks at him, bemused. He gets in quickly. MILTON frowns but shrugs and walks off with a wave. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, have a nice time boys. Inside the car COLIN looks at ROGER. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she okay? In the same moment MARILYN herself erupts from under the blanket in the back. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus - She laughs, looking wonderfully naughty. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger and I decided to take you out for an adventure. Didn't we Roger? ROGER (PAINED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed we did. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. If Milton sees me with you... I'll be sacked... He tries to scramble out but MARILYN hauls him back gleefully. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 83.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can sack you, Colin. (Pause) Except me, of course. She pats the seat next to her. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like being on my own in the back. Before COLIN can respond he sees the curious MILTON runni back, having spotted MARILYN in the back. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? He peers into the back window. MARILYN screams and buries herself back under the blanket. COLIN scrambles to get ov into the back seat while ROGER stamps on the accelerator the car roars off. MILTON (CONT'D) (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin! Get back here, you little bastard! You're fired! Do you hear me? Fired! COLIN winces. ROGER looks at him sympathetically. MARILYN emerges from under the blanket, tousled and laughing. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he saw me? COLIN can't help laughing. He finally tumbles into the ba seat with MARILYN as the car speeds away. She scoots up t make room for him. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snuggle up. This is fun. She threads her arm through his. He gazes down at their h meshed together. ROGER's disapproval registers in the faintest flicker of eyes. In the background the defeated and frustrated MILTON watc the car speed away. CUT TO:  112 DELETED 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and MARILYN walk barefoot in the grass of Windsor Great Park while ROGER leans on the bonnet of the parked Wolsey, holding shoes, socks, and sandals. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one else around. The wind sighs and the grass is pleasantly warm underfoot. MARILYN turns her face up t the sun. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how I ought to feel every day. COLIN smiles. Impulsively MARILYN hugs him. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's run away together. He turns ashen. MARILYN (CONT'D) (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding. She looks around happily. COLIN smiles at her. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have today, anyway. One day to do whatever we like. We can go back to real life tomorrow. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one day? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe the weekend. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a week? He grins. She takes his hand, walking contentedly at his side. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall we do? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could go to Windsor Castle, if you like. MARILYN's face breaks into a smile of pure delight. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car makes its stately progress down the magnificent drive towards the castle. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER has parked up by the sentry post at the entrance to the castle. There are two uniformed POLICEMEN on duty. ROGER nods to the policemen, who instantly recognise one their own. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Chief Superintendant Smith. I'm escorting this lady and gentleman for the day. They'd like to look around the castle. As the policemen see MARILYN their eyes widen. POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, is that..? He stares in disbelief. ROGER smiles. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not Diana bloody Dors, is it? POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) Does she know anyone here, sir? We need to write down a contact name in the book. ROGER looks stumped at this. He turns to Marilyn. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Her Majesty, by any chance? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met at a movie premiere. She said my dress was pretty. POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that quite... COLIN (INTERRUPTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Godfather works here. He's the Royal librarian, Sir Owen Morshead. The POLICEMAN looks sceptically at Colin's casual clothes POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark. Colin Clark. The POLICEMAN retreats into his box. We hear him talking the telephone. ROGER looks at COLIN. He shrugs sheepishly MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 86.  COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father knows everybody. A moment later the policeman returns, looking surprised. POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says to go straight up the hill, sir. You'll be met at the door. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and MARILYN are led by a FOOTMAN down the long corridor. MARILYN looks awed by the ancient suits of armo standing regally along the way. COLIN watches her, enjoyi her reaction. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and MARILYN are led into another corridor, this one with a beautiful gold-leaf ceiling decoration. MARILYN lo up, enchanted. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The library is a series of magnificent rooms lined from floor to ceiling with books and prints. Every surface is covered with important documents - the place is a shrine antique learning and culture. SIR OWEN MORSHEAD (63), the Queen's librarian, is a pleasantly eccentric figure with sly wit. He greets COLIN with a friendly, distracted air. MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin, my boy! Come in, come in. Forgive the dust. He smiles at MARILYN, showing no sign whatever of recognising her. MORSHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are pretty, my dear. I'm sure you and Colin have so much in common. MARILYN looks around in awe. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I'd love to read all these books some time. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 87.  MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily one doesn't really have to. A lot of them just have pictures in. He finds a portfolio on the table and opens it. MORSHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are by an artist called Holbein. MARILYN smiles at a portrait of a young woman. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful. MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the daughter of one of the King's courtiers, nearly 400 years ago. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I look that good when I'm 400. MORSHEAD laughs. He takes down another folder of drawings MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these are all by Leonardo Da Vinci. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of him! Didn't he paint that lady with the funny smile? She looks at him, wide-eyed, playing up to her image as t dizzy blonde. In fact she knows exactly who Da Vinci is, MORSHEAD is tactful enough to acknowledge it gracefully. MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mona Lisa. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have that one here too? MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, that one got away. He closes the portfolio and takes MARILYN's arm briskly. MORSHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's go to the Queen's apartments. She's not here at the moment, but she will be sorry to have missed you. MARILYN looks at him, wide-eyed. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 88.  MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Why, she was only saying to me the other day, "what must it be like to be the most famous woman on earth"? He shares a sly smile with COLIN. He knows exactly who Marilyn is and is enjoying every second of her company. H leads her out, with COLIN trailing in their wake. MORSHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the rooms are very opulent but I think there's something you might like better than all that. CUT TO:  117 DELETED 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN on a massive dolls' house. Everything imaginable is inside - beds, chairs, baths, basins, even small rugs and chandeliers, all perfectly to scale. MARILYN kneels in front of it, gazing from room to room with childlike joy. It is so big she can lean inside and see the detail in every room. She cries out with joy. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Colin. COLIN kneels at her side. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure never had a dolls' house like this when I was a kid. She sees a perfect doll family inside, husband, wife and two children. She points at them, her eyes shining. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me, that's you, and these are our kids. She smiles wistfully and puts her hand on his arm. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our daughter's so pretty. All little girls should be told how pretty they are. They should grow up knowing how much their mother loves them. Her eyes fill with sadness for a moment. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look like such a happy family, don't we? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him. They are only inches away from each other. COLIN's heart lurches. MORSHEAD coughs discreetly. MORSHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't let me keep you. I'm sure you're longing to be on your way. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and MARILYN emerge. A small crowd of POLICEMEN, SERVANTS and CASTLE WORKERS has gathered. There are cheer as they see her. COLIN looks nervously at MARILYN but she smiles and winks at him, mocking herself gently. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I be "her"? She jumps up onto a step and strikes a pose - hip out, shoulders back, bosom thrust forward, the classic Marilyn "look". The delighted crowd bursts into cheers. COLIN stands proudly nearby, content to watch Marilyn being a star, basking in the certain knowledge that she will be leaving with him. One of the spectators turns to him. SPECTATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you somebody, mate? COLIN (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no one. COLIN stares at MARILYN. She catches his eye and smiles, just for him. He feels like he's tumbling into the abyss, but no longer cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger's car pulls up outside Eton College. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and an astonished MARILYN walk through the school buildings with ROGER a discreet distance behind them. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a school, it's a palace! COLIN smiles. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eton is 500 years old. It was founded by King Henry VI. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 89A.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like walking through history. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that room up there. They stop as COLIN points up at a window. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 90.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where the boys were sent if they didn't work hard enough. Where we were whipped. MARILYN looks at him in shock. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whipped? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaten. She looks appalled. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never send my kids away. (pause) How long were you here? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years. But I was sent to boarding school when I was eight. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we do in my family. She smiles at this, looking at him shrewdly. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems to me that you've had most things pretty easy. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one way, yes. But when you're brought up in a house of over- achievers, it's hard to make your own mark. She looks at him, sympathetic but pushing a little harder MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are you going to do it? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it will be in films, but if not, there are so many possibilities out there. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds pretty good to me. She smiles warmly, liking him a lot more for his openness We sense their relationship has moved quietly to a differ and deeper level. But before either of them can say anything a SCHOOLBOY tu the corner in his Eton uniform. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 90A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at MARILYN, his mouth hanging open in shock. he simply turns and runs, shouting at the top of his voic SCHOOLBOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn! It's Marilyn Monroe! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN and COLIN are swamped in a joyous mass of Eton students. MARILYN smiles, waves, pouts, even kisses one b on the cheek. Cheering BOYS hang out of every window. MARILYN blows kisses to them all. ROGER has to plunge int the crowd to rescue her. COLIN follows after them with difficulty. MARILYN pauses, jumping on a bench to wave goodbye and blow more kisses to the boys. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work hard, boys! I don't want anyone whipping you! A gawky young teenager near the front shouts out cheekily BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can whip me anytime, Marilyn! MARILYN laughs in delight. There are cheers as COLIN escorts her away. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER leans back against the car, smoking calmly. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the riotous excitement of the Eton schoolyard the peace and quiet of the river. MARILYN rushes along the sandy bank. The water glitters magically. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, slow poke. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we haven't got any... He stops in mid-sentence as he sees MARILYN unbuttoning h blouse and throwing it off carelessly. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears his eyes away from her as she casually strips he clothes off. He hurries to find a bush to get changed behind. As he ducks down behind it he hears a splash and MARILYN's cry of shock as she hits the water. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh! It's freezing! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN swims in the water, humming softly to herself. COLIN wades in, wincing at the cold. She laughs. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if a boat goes past? We could be arrested. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Roger will fix it. Oh, darn it... She holds her head and he looks at her with concern. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something in my eye. He swims across to her, very aware of her naked body unde the water. She holds her head up to him. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see anything. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get closer. She tips her head back. He looks deep into her eyes - and suddenly she grabs him and kisses him on the lips. Before he can respond she laughs playfully and swims away. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first time I've kissed anyone younger than me. There's a lot of older guys in Hollywood. She swims happily, totally relaxed. COLIN is much more se conscious, keeping one nervous eye open for pleasure boat Finally she swims back into the shallows and wades to the shore. She glances back, catching Colin looking. He glanc away, embarrassed. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 92.  MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be shy, Colin. It's nothing you haven't seen before. COLIN wades awkwardly to the shore, trying to conceal his erection with his cupped hands. MARILYN giggles. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Colin! And you an old Etonian! He grins. She reaches for her blouse and stands shivering as she tries to dry herself. COLIN goes to take her in hi arms. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me warm you up. She snuggles into him gratefully, her teeth chattering. H rubs her naked back briskly, her thin blouse the only barrier between their bodies. Slowly his embrace becomes more sensual, his hands slowing, stroking rather than rubbing, his face buried in her hair, his arms pulling he CLOSER - MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't spoil it. She looks at him, her expression knowing but sweet. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this to be the perfect date. He tries to kiss her but she ducks her head away gently, her expression wistful. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had a real date since I was 13 years old. She suddenly looks much younger, her smile a poignant ech of a lost childhood. He steps back politely, allowing her to put on her blouse As she buttons it, she gazes at him, then impulsively lea forward to kiss him chastely on the lips. The kiss is as sweet and innocent as any 13 year old might wish. The kiss lasts for a few seconds, their lips touching gently, the river shimmering magically in the sunshine behind them. When they finally break apart she rewards hi with a radiant smile. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was nice. I don't get kissed much. She looks wistful for a second but quickly brightens. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 93.  MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what do we do now? COLIN looks at her, knowing it is time to return to the real world but reluctant to face it. There is a discreet cough and ROGER appears. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go home, I think, Miss Monroe. She smiles, a little sadly, then gets up, walking past hi as she puts on the rest of her clothes. ROGER averts his eyes respectfully and waits for COLIN. The two men look a each other for a second. ROGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
