dialogues.text: Be careful not to get in too deep, son. COLIN knows he isn't talking about the river. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN and COLIN sit in silence in the back of the car. Her exuberance has vanished and there is a distant look i her eye. COLIN wants to say something but can't think of the right words. He puts his hand on hers and she squeeze it, but then pulls away. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PARKSIDE HOUSE. ROGER'S CAR. DAY. 126
dialogues.text: A seething MILTON is waiting on the steps as ROGER parks the car. COLIN looks at him nervously. MARILYN looks at h then gets out, glancing at Milton indifferently. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Milton. She smiles sweetly. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I come on set, you better make sure Colin is there. He looks at her in shock then bitterly at COLIN. MARILYN (CONT'D) (TO ROGER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him home. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves briefly to Colin, nothing more than a flutter o her fingers. COLIN watches her all the way up the steps until she disappears inside. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew are ready, the cast stand around in full costume OLIVIER paces the set - and there is no sign of Marilyn. OLIVIER turns to COLIN. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spent the day with her. What frame of mind was she in? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was fine. OLIVIER (HUGE SELF-CONTROL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, find out what's going on. There's a good chap. Perhaps we can persuade her on this splendid day to do the work she's paying herself to do. He stalks off. COLIN sees WATTIS grinning at him. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start, Dicky. WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get any sympathy from me, dear. Frankly I wouldn't care if Marilyn dropped dead tomorrow. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's trying her best. WATTIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's Marilyn Monroe. This is her life. Pills, booze, sex, more pills. (Pause) God, it must be wonderful! COLIN doesn't laugh. WATTIS looks at him sympathetically. WATTIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. Little Colin's in love. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON is waiting for COLIN at the door. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn's not well. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 95.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was wonderful yesterday. MILTON looks at him for a long moment, masking his hostility in barbed politeness. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you did to her, kid, but she got nervous. I had to give her some pills to calm her down. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't need pills! She just needs someone to care for her. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone like you? COLIN reddens. MILTON shakes his head patronisingly. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm not in love with her! MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kissed her. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said that? MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me the bullshit. I know everything. COLIN stares at him, feeling hopelessly out of his depth. MILTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You messed her up, kid. Confused her. He comes very close, his tone fierce but wounded. MILTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got every penny I ever made tied up in Marilyn. She owes me. If it wasn't for me she'd still be on contracts that make slave wages look good. I gave her back her freedom, and now Miller's turning her against me. That's what you get for trying to help Marilyn Monroe. He goes back to the house, pausing at the door, speaking more in sorrow than anger. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 96.  MILTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to play with the grown-ups, Colin, start learning the rules. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gentle summer breeze lifts the net curtains. COLIN is fast asleep. There's a sharp rap at the door. ROGER (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin! (Pause) Colin! COLIN opens his eyes, his mind drugged with sleep. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger? What's the matter? ROGER (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Marilyn. A cold dread clutches at COLIN's stomach. He stumbles out of bed and opens the door. ROGER stands in the doorway COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she dead? ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's asking for you. She's sick. I think she might be in a coma. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can she be asking for me if she's in a coma? ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bloody get dressed! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER and COLIN drive up. MILTON, waits on the steps. He looks resentfully at COLIN but doesn't say anything. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAULA STRASBERG paces frantically outside Marilyn's bedro door as ROGER, MILTON and COLIN hurry up the stairs. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 97.  PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't made a sound for over an hour. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should break down the door. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many pills did she take? MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, who knows? I wasn't counting. COLIN knocks gently. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn? There is no reply. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER and COLIN carry a ladder across the moonlit gravel and prop it up against the wall. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her window. He points with his torch. The window is open. COLIN shins up the ladder while ROGER holds it. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll open the door once I'm inside. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN tumbles in through the window with a clattering thump. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn? A shaft of moonlight reveals MARILYN lying naked across t bed, her body partly covered by the sheet. Half empty pil and champagne bottles are scattered all over her dresser; there is also an old photograph in a silver frame of her mother Gladys. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn? For a second he fears the worst, but then suddenly she groans and sits up, looking at him blearily. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 98.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi, Colin. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Everyone was worried about you. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phooey. She pats the sheets at her side and settles down sleepily on the pillow. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. She is instantly back asleep. COLIN fumbles his way to th door. He searches for the key on the side table and quick finds it. He goes to unlock the door, but then pauses, looking back at Marilyn. He puts the key back and bends down to whisper at the keyhole. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. She's fine but I'm going to keep an eye on her. I'll sleep on the sofa. MILTON (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Colin, open up. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) I can't find the key. (Pause) You can all go to bed now. PAULA (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin, open this door! She needs me... COLIN goes back to the bed and gazes at the sleeping Marilyn, his expression suffused with a tenderness we hav never seen in him before. He pulls up the sheet so that i covers her nakedness, then tentatively lies down to rest his head on the pillow. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN wakes with a jolt as the light snaps on, blinding him. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin? What are you doing here? MARILYN sits up, the sheet clutched to her chest, her expression panicky and disoriented. COLIN hurls himself o the bed. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 99.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came in through the window... He realises this doesn't sound reassuring. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton thought you were sick. She stares at him in puzzlement then breaks into a dazed smile. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window? Is there a balcony, like in Romeo And Juliet? How romantic. (Pause) But I'm not sick. What makes them think that? She reaches instinctively for the pill container on her bedside table. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't take any more pills. She frowns, clutching the pill bottle in one hand. He reaches out and prises it gently from her grasp. As he pu it back on the side he glances at the framed photograph. COLIN (CONT'D) (cont'd) Who's that? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom. Her expression softens as she looks at the picture. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took her to the Sanatorium when I was a kid. I grew up in other people's homes, mostly. Alongside her mother's photo is another framed picture, this time of Abraham Lincoln. COLIN frowns. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abraham Lincoln? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who my father is so it might as well be him. Why not? I can pick any father I want. She smiles, then looks at Colin wistfully. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a home, Colin? A real one? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 100.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a mother and father who still live together? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do they love you? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they do. He nods. She smiles sadly. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky. Her eyes fill with tears. She looks up at him anxiously. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me, Colin? He stares at her. She looks lovely but desperately vulnerable. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She reaches for the pills and pours three or four into he palm. COLIN gently takes her hand and takes two of them away. She smiles, not objecting as he settles her back gently on the pillow. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you and I come from different worlds. You're like some Greek Goddess to me... MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Greek. She smiles, teasing him. He smiles back. She takes his hand, looking at him in appeal. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be a Goddess. I just want to be loved like an ordinary girl. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller loves you. She stares at him, her face going blank with misery. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found his notebook. It said I'd let him down. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 101.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writers scribble all kinds of things. It doesn't mean anything. She looks at him, her eyes full of pain. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted me to find it. It said he should never have married me. That I was unpredictable and a woman-child, flighty and self- centred. He's left me, Colin. Why do the people I love always leave me? She looks so wretched, so completely baffled, that COLIN responds with sudden passion. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never leave you. She smiles and embraces him gratefully. She sighs. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All people ever see is Marilyn Monroe. As soon as they realise I'm not her, they run. He lies down next to her, taking her awkwardly in his arm She sighs sleepily. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, there's a lot of men in this business. And they all think you've got to sleep with them. She looks across at him, their faces inches apart. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not like that. That's why I like you. COLIN stares back at her guiltily. She smiles. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should date that Wardrobe lady. She's pretty. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to. (Pause) I love you, Marilyn. She stares at him and tears gather in her eyes again. The stare intently at each other, their mood fragile, touched with both sensuality and a longing for something less tangible. MARILYN leans forward and kisses him gently. Th embrace grows in passion and they kiss properly, hungrily He kisses her eyes and her face and she sighs happily. He wants her more than he has wanted anything before. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he stops. The fantasy he has been pursuing for weeks is within his grasp but he knows that whatever it does for him it will only damage her further. He pulls aw from her gently. Her eyes flicker open lazily. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Don't you want to make love? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just be friends. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Friends. She wraps herself around him, curling up so their bodies cradle each other like spoons in a cutlery draw. As she buries her head in his neck he feels her breasts against his back. She curls against him. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nice. Like spoons. I used to do this with Johnny. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Johnny? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Hyde. My agent, back in the old days. He was thin, like you... Her voice is blurred and drifting with sleep. With her bo warm against him COLIN's resolve nearly snaps but he is clear eyed now and determined. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn? She mutters softly in reply. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do one thing for me? Come into the studio on time tomorrow and show everybody what you can do. Show Larry you're a great actress. MARILYN (BLURRED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He smiles and turns out the light. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First light streams in through the curtains. COLIN wakes hear Marilyn singing cheerfully. He gets up and sees her through the open door of the bathroom sitting in the bath her back towards him. She is practicing the gentle waltz tune she is to sing in the film. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through... I'm yours no matter what others may say or do... She has never sounded so happy or carefree. COLIN smiles. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN races up the road and arrives panting at the gate a few seconds before OLIVIER's car swings into the entrance The great man leans out of the back window. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, boy. (Pause) Christ, you look rough. He looks at him thoughtfully, then shrugs. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know when Marilyn arrives. If she ever does. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm pretty sure she'll be in this morning. OLIVIER gives COLIN an odd look. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN, OLIVIER and WATTIS act a scene together; a drunk Elsie Marina is being seduced by the Grand Duke, and Northbrook bursts in to interrupt them as a VALET plays t violin in the doorway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: WATTIS, (AS NORTHBROOK)
dialogues.text: "Your Grand Ducal Highness.."

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIER, (AS REGENT)
dialogues.text: "This is intolerable"!

dialogues.speaker: WATTIS, (AS NORTHBROOK)
dialogues.text: "With the deepest respect, sir, my message was so important I had no choice but to intrude". MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 104.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIER, (AS REGENT)
dialogues.text: "Revolution?"

dialogues.speaker: WATTIS, (AS NORTHBROOK)
dialogues.text: "No, sir, Miss Marina's aunt has been in a motor accident. The hospital is calling for her most urgently."

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "What? (Giggles drunkenly) Oh, go away, you silly man."

dialogues.speaker: WATTIS, (AS NORTHBROOK)
dialogues.text: "Miss Marina, your aunt... you realise how serious her condition is?"

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "Well, it's her own fault. She has no right being out at this time of night. She's 93!" MARILYN is utterly adorable. The crew, COLIN, amongst the can't take their eyes off her. OLIVIER glances at ORTON behind the camera. They have a good take and they know it ORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it there! MARILYN is as happy as we have ever seen her. She seeks o COLIN amongst the crowd and beams at him. Half the crew, including OLIVIER, notice the look. COLIN blushes self- consciously but we can feel his pride. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT.
dialogues.text: OLIVIER takes off his make-up. COLIN stands behind him wi the end of day bottle of whisky. OLIVIER is in buoyant mood. It has been a good day. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it was you did to her, boy, keep doing it. OLIVIER grins slyly and COLIN doesn't bother to protest. The phone rings. OLIVIER picks it up. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? His face falls as he listens to the voice at the other en of the line. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN paces nervously up and down the hall. PAULA appears She looks at him for a long, unnerving moment then speaks with sudden ferocity. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the first moment all I have felt is Olivier's loathing and contempt. He thinks I'm unnecessary. Me, her drama coach, surrogate mother, nursemaid. On call 24 hours a day to help her act, dole out pills, bolster her ego, keep her sober enough to work. (Pause) Me. Unnecessary. (Pause) No me, no Marilyn. He is taken aback by her passion. She smiles bitterly the walks on. COLIN hesitates. She looks back briefly. PAULA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come up now. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN lies in bed with MILTON possessively at her side. COLIN comes in with PAULA. MARILYN looks at him dully, he eyes clouded and unfocused. A half empty pill bottle stan on the side. COLIN sits down next to her and she takes hi hand, ignoring the surprised look on Milton's face. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I can act, don't you, Colin? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. You were wonderful today. PAULA looks at MILTON, then moves between them busily. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn's tired now. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to stay with me. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would Arthur say if he knew Colin was here? A flicker of terror crosses MARILYN's face. COLIN turns o them angrily. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what she said. She wants me here. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON looks at him grimly but finally surrenders the field. Paula is more reluctant to give in. She sits on th bed, stroking Marilyn's hand. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea of your position in the world, Marilyn. You are the greatest actress there's ever been. Not just actress. The greatest woman of this or any time. I love you like a daughter. COLIN is surprised to see tears in her eyes. PAULA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard now, but believe me you will survive this and go on to better things. Your life is ahead of you. You're young, just beginning. Paula's love and sincerity are obvious. She means it. COL watches her in silence. MARILYN squeezes her hand and PAU gets up with a heavy sigh, bitterly reluctant to leave. Finally she drags herself out, leaving them alone. As the door closes MARILYN curls herself up in the bed. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so tired of feeling scared. Life is so shitty. I hate it. It hurts too much. COLIN looks at her, his heart breaking at her anguish. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here now. I'll look after you. She gives him a wry look, teasing but thoughtful. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good old Colin. Looking after me, looking after Larry, looking after Vivien. Always putting everyone before yourself. There is an edge to this. He gazes at her, shaken, but sh smiles and touches his face gently. He gets on the bed, fully clothed, to fold her in his arm CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN wakes with a start as he realises that MARILYN is screaming in pain. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts! It hurts, Colin! She is doubled up, clutching her stomach, sweating and frightened. COLIN sees a dark red stain on the sheets. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby. I can't lose the baby. COLIN looks at her aghast. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a surprise. For Arthur. Don't tell anyone. Promise me. He hurls himself off the bed and runs to the door. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT.
dialogues.text: MILTON and COLIN wait by the bathroom in Marilyn's suite. ROGER hurries in. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor's coming. COLIN turns the handle but the bathroom door is locked. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn, unlock the door. MARILYN (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let anyone in. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. MILTON gives him a sharp look but he no longer cares abou anything except Marilyn. There is a shuffling sound and t door is unlocked. At the same moment PAULA comes rushing in, hair awry, gown flapping, a wild look in her eye. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn! Marilyn, my baby, what has Colin done to you? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't done anything. She's just... got a stomach ache. He reddens with embarrassment. ROGER coughs. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 108.  ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he means her monthlies. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will Arthur say if she dies? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not dying, for Christ's sake. The HOUSEKEEPER now appears at the door with an elderly m at her side. He nods briskly. CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Connell. Is the patient in there? PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please save her... it's Marilyn Monroe. You can't let her die. CONNELL calmly extracts himself from her grasp. CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd all like to give us a little privacy? As COLIN shepherds the others out MILTON turns on him bitterly. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy now, kid? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. CONNELL stands in the hall outside the bedroom writin out a prescription and smoking a cigarette. He tears the prescription off the pad and looks up. CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here? MILTON, PAULA, ROGER and COLIN all step forward as one. CONNELL gives them a wry look and shrugs. CONNELL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given Mrs. Miller an injection and the bleeding has stopped. She needs to stay in bed tomorrow but after that she'll be fine. I suggest someone stays with her. PAULA leans forward and almost snatches the prescription from his hand. PAULA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be safe with me. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks bitterly at Colin. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN walks CONNELL to his car, their feet crunching on t gravel. CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, goodnight then. COLIN holds the door open as he gets in. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she really pregnant? CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a private matter between Mr and Mrs. Miller. He looks at COLIN with cool disapproval, then closes the door and drives off. COLIN stands watching, shivering in his shirtsleeves. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN creeps into the room and sits on the bed. MARILYN i awake. She gazes at him, hazy but lucid. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to say goodbye now, Colin. Arthur's on his way back. When this film is over I'm going to settle down and be a good wife to him. I'm going to learn to make Matzo ball soup as good as his dad's. She smiles wistfully at the fantasy. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to forget this ever happened. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to forget. He struggles then suddenly bursts out passionately. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me protect you from all this... She smiles sadly. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 110.  MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do? Marry me? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? You could come and live at my parents place. You'd love it. It's a castle, like in a fairy tale. We wouldn't even have to live together. You could have your own suite of rooms... He is close to tears, suddenly looking very young. She looks at him with a sad, sweet smile. He shakes his head stubbornly, taking her hand in passionate appeal. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could quit. Forget Marilyn Monroe, forget Hollywood. Let it all go. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I've worked for my whole life. I couldn't just give it all up. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not, when it drives you crazy? Her eyes widen in surprise. A flicker of nervous insecuri dulls her expression. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm crazy? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean that. I just meant you could be happy. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy. I got everything I ever dreamed about. She smiles tentatively, but he sees a terrible fear in he eyes. He looks down, realising with a cruel stab of pain that Olivier was right. There is no way back. She doesn't want to be rescued. He finally looks up, smiling despite the tears in his eye COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you're happy. (Pause) You're a star. The biggest star in the world. She smiles, reassured. He drags himself off the bed and goes to the door, pausing for a second as he looks back. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Marilyn. We have to forget all this. (MORE)
COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on I'm nobody. Just the third. You don't even know I exist. We'll never look at each other again. She giggles with some of her old playfulness. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe just a wink. Once in a while. He smiles, looks at her just once more, and then goes out As the door closes we see Marilyn's smile fade to be replaced by a bleak, frightened expression. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: OLIVIER sits in front of his make-up mirror in his Grand Ducal uniform, smoothing down his hair with pomade. COLIN knocks and comes in. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready for you on set, Sir Laurence. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just arrived. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only an hour late. Not bad by her standards. He smiles, then stands up, straightening his uniform. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we will finish this bloody film after all. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew are ready. The actors are on set. OLIVIER stands the camera. COLIN is half-hidden in the shadows. There is flurry of activity and MARILYN emerges, with PAULA on one side and MILTON on the other. She looks exactly as Marily should. With her white dress shimmering in the lights and platinum blonde hair glowing, she has the air of a Goddes She sweeps past only inches away from Colin but ignores h He can't help feeling a stiletto sharp pang of regret.

dialogues.speaker: 112A.
dialogues.text: MARILYN turns to the assembled crew. A silence settles. S smiles around, blinking in the lights. She looks for comf or support among the technicians but sees only blank face sullen hostility. She smiles nervously. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you will all forgive me. It wasn't altogether my fault. I have been ill. She smiles up at their uneasy expressions, struggling to understand herself and their expectations of her. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to remember I tried. This oddly moving and open confession is received in sile No one quite knows how to react to her lacerating honesty Perhaps they think it is just another performance. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER, in character, lies back on a sofa, with MARILYN top of him, singing the waltz that Colin first heard afte his night with her. MARILYN looks kittenish and irresisti as she sings only a few inches from OLIVIER's face.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "..I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through, I'm yours no matter what others may say or do. Be light of heart and fancy free, that's the way to start, there will be nothing to lose till you lose your heart.." She sings with touching delicacy, nailing it perfectly. T is pin drop silence on the set as the crew watch. COLIN i amongst them. It is a moment of almost unbearable poignan for him. He suddenly realises that SYBIL THORNDIKE has cr up silently behind him to watch the scene. As he turns to she smiles with infinite wisdom and compassion, murmuring softly so that only he can hear. SYBIL THORNDIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First love is such sweet despair, Colin. She touches his cheek gently and smiles, perhaps lost in long ago memory of her own, before retreating quietly int the darkness at the back of the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inch by laborious inch The Sleeping Prince moves towards finish line. We see a montage of scenes being filmed - - HARDWICK enters as Major Domo through the main door of oval room, carrying a silver tray bearing shaving equipment... - WATTIS and JEREMY SPENSER crossing the drawing room to Grand Duke's bedroom... - WATTIS crosses the drawing room and knocks on a door... The process is hardly any easier but somehow the work is done, until we come to the final shot in the sequence - ORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very quiet, studio! Going for a take. The big overhead lights switch on with a series of heavy clunks. DENYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera running! Speed! MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 113A.  ORTON

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: MARILYN looks up, in character as Elsie, her eyes glowing

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIER, (AS REGENT)
dialogues.text: "My dear..."

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "I've got a solemn word of warning for you."

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIER, (AS REGENT)
dialogues.text: "What's that, my beloved?"

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN, (AS ELSIE)
dialogues.text: "You know what's going to happen? I'm going to fall in love with you, because I always, always do." CLOSE on MARILYN as she smiles, her face radiating joy an vitality. And then, in the split second before ORTON calls `cut', MARILYN turns her head just a fraction and winks at Colin grins. OLIVIER looks up from the sofa, notices and smiles indulgently. ORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut! Okay boys and girls, that's a wrap! There is a smattering of applause from the crew. MARILYN leaves the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN walks away from us, down the long corridor, alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew shake hands and clap each other on the back like group of hardened war veterans. ORTON offers COLIN a grudging nod - `well done'. MILTON now comes forward, calling out above the hubbub. MILTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd all like to step this way, you'll find something I think you'll like. MILTON indicates a trestle table at one end of the studio loaded with gaily wrapped parcels. He ushers the crew ove MILTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parting gift to each of you from Marilyn. Men on the left, ladies on the right. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 113B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first there is a buzz of excitement but then something happens. One of the crew simply picks up his present with looking at it and drops it in the large bin standing agai the wall. There is a moment, then a WOMAN does the same with hers. Suddenly there is a rush for the bin as almost everyone d their present. The bin is soon overflowing. MILTON stares at the scene, then simply shrugs and walks ARTHUR JACOBS, utterly indifferent to the hostile undercurrent, grins and waves cheerfully. JACOBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a lot of fun, kids. See you at the Academy Awards. He goes out, grabbing a discarded bottle of booze from th dustbin as he goes. COLIN watches all this in shocked silence. He looks at th label on his own small parcel, which reads simply "To Col with thanks, Marilyn". MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 114.  150 OMITTED 150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wardrobe department is empty except for LUCY, who cradles her own gift from Marilyn. COLIN comes in, lookin nervous. They look at each other awkwardly. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to throw yours away? LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. It's from Marilyn Monroe. He smiles. She shrugs and turns to leave. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 115.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) Lucy? She turns back to look at him. COLIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you're doing anything this Saturday. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm washing my hair. He nods, accepting this as no more than he deserves. She goes but then stops to look back at him. LUCY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she break your heart? COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) A little. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. It needed breaking. There is no malice in her response, just an awareness tha he is older and wiser now, and perhaps a better man for t experience. He nods, accepting the rebuke. LUCY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) I might be free on Wednesday. COLIN smiles. She goes out. He looks down at Marilyn's present in his hands. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN walks down the hall. He notices the red light is on outside the viewing theatre. As he goes towards it he see ROGER coming the other way on his way out of the studio, job done. The two men smile; an acknowledgment of everyth they've been through together. ROGER offers him a friendl salute and then goes on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVIER sits on his own, watching an edited version of th "The Coconut Girl" sequence (Scenes 61 and 62). COLIN com in. OLIVIER glances at him. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You do look, my son, in a moved sort/As if you were dismay'd: be cheerful, sir./Our revels now are ended. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 116.
dialogues.text: OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These our actors,/As I foretold you, were all spirits and/Are melted into air, into thin air... COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prospero. OLIVIER (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are such stuff/As dreams are made on, and our little life/Is rounded with a sleep..." COLIN sits down next to the great man. They watch in silence as another sequence is projected for them. The sequence shows MARILYN improvising in the champagne and caviar scene. She serves herself food and drink before collapsing, drunk. The endless retakes and fluffs gone, what remains is a gifted comic performance by a luminous beauty. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a second) She's quite wonderful. No training, no craft, no guile, just pure instinct. Astonishing. He seems almost lost in awe. COLIN gazes at him in surprise. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should tell her that. OLIVIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I will. But she won't believe me. That's probably what makes her great. It's certainly what makes her so profoundly unhappy. He smiles wryly. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried my best to change her, but she remains brilliant despite me. (Pause) Directing a movie has to be just about the best job ever invented, but Marilyn has cured me of ever wanting to do it again. He signals to the projection box and the film stops as th lights come up. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm going back to the theatre. John Osborne is writing a piece for me. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you hated all that Royal Court stuff. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 117.  OLIVIER (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller made me see things differently. (Pause) You have to find new worlds to conquer, if you want to be the best. And believe me, most of the time, I really am the best. He goes to the door and pauses. OLIVIER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done a good job, boy. (Pause) Welcome to the circus. He goes out. COLIN looks back up at the projection box. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run it again, please. The lights go down. MARILYN's face appears on the screen, laughing and happy. It is another sequence, the one where Marilyn does her sweet, uninhibited little dance (Scene 90), a performance both sexy and yet touchingly innocent. HOLD on COLIN for a long moment, gazing at her image in t darkness, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circus is leaving. The film is shutting down. Not kno his next job COLIN sits, suitcase next to his chair, wear the 'Marilyn' experience on his face and in his soul. Hea down, sipping a pint. He could be a regular here. BARRY behind the bar, flitting around - the dart players regulars at play. And then, as if a gust of wind invaded, BARRY looks up an freezes. The DART PLAYER, sensing something, turns to loo as well. The regulars are frozen in mid-action. COLIN is missing it all. 100% of his attention is given t his woe and his pint. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy a girl a drink? COLIN doesn't turn. He recognizes the voice and smiles. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get another one of those please, Barry? BARRY for once is silent, pours a pint. The regulars try to stare. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to leave without saying goodbye. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 117A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARILYN hands COLIN a package. MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time you saw this, all I had on was the radio. Colin opens the package. It's her copy of the script. On first page she has written a message scrawled in ink: TO

dialogues.speaker: MOST CHARMING THIRD ASSISTANT DIRECTOR IN THE WORLD
dialogues.text: MARILYN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget me. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if I could. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else on the picture wishes they could. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else doesn't understand. She smiles, touched. MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a gentleman and walk me to my car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152B EXT. DOG & DUCK PUB. DAY 152B The ever faithful Roger stands by the idling car. COLIN o the car door for MARILYN. MARILYN beckons him closer. She kisses him gently. He smi and says lightly: COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for? MARILYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for being on my side; and remember, when you see me wink, that's for you. ROGER walks around the car and looks over at COLIN. ROGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at COLIN) Looking a couple of inches taller than when I first saw you. ROGER nods at COLIN (a silent salute suggesting job well done.) He gets into the car and we stay on COLIN as he watches it pull away. BARRY comes to the doorway of the p BARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that really Marilyn Monroe? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 117B.  COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - just a good friend of mine. BARRY walks back into the pub, leaving COLIN alone, stari at the vanishing car. And then the sun swallows it as it drives into the English countryside. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN walks along chatting to friends. Dressed in a neat dark suit he looks older and more confident. There is little sign left of the callow young man who paced up and down the pavement outside Sir Laurence Olivier's office. We see the caption: SIX YEARS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN walks into a small office. Film cans are piled up a over the floor and books and papers spill off the shelves A SECRETARY sits typing at her desk. COLIN goes to his ow desk, glances at his diary, then looks up. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any messages? THE SECRETARY pushes a piece of paper at him. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably just someone having a joke. COLIN looks down at the message. There is a Los Angeles phone number and then the name - Marilyn Monroe. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a moment) Did she say anything? MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 118.  SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just asked you to call. (Pause) It is a joke, isn't it? COLIN stares down at the paper. COLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. (Pause) Book a call as soon as you can. Los Angeles, California. Brentwood 1890. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is late. COLIN stares at the number on the scrap of paper. The phone rings. He picks it up eagerly. OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your call to Los Angeles. We hear the crackle of the international line. He waits anxiously as the ringing continues. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISH the luxurious exterior of Marilyn's comfortable Brentwood house. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: The room is large and tasteful - white sofas and cushions and deep rugs. Picture windows look out onto the Hollywoo hills. A white phone rings on the table. It rings continuously, insistently. It carries on ringing. No one comes. HOLD on the jangling phone. Each time it rings we think Marilyn might appear, but she never does. It carries on ringing, unanswered, in the empty room. As the picture fades we hear like a ghostly lament the sweet echo of Marilyn's voice singing the Sleeping Prince Waltz MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 119.  MARILYN (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through, I'm yours no matter what others may say or do. Be light of heart and fancy free, that's the way to start, there will be nothing to lose till you lose your heart..." The fragile voice hangs in the air for a second, then slo drifts away to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN sits with the phone to his ear. The sound of Marily singing the Sleeping Prince Waltz dies away and we realis has been revisiting it in his memory. He waits as long as he can but it is obvious no one is go to answer. In the end he puts the receiver back in its cr in resignation. His gaze drifts up to a shelf stacked with film cans. He stands up and looks through them, blowing dust away; they have been here for a long time, ignored. He finds the one is looking for - it says simply MM on the can. He takes the short reel of film and threads it through a Movieola in the corner of the room. He turns it on and be to look. The screen bursts into life with an image of MARILYN at h most vital and captivating. It is a copy of some rushes f The Prince And The Showgirl, perhaps given to Colin by Olivier, or perhaps "borrowed" as a souvenir and long sin forgotten. We see MARILYN dancing happily, exaggerating off camera, looking playful and sexy. She is radiant and full of life After a moment she turns and looks off camera - perhaps t where Colin himself would have been standing - and winks happily. Blown up to the full size of the screen it is utterly swe and charming. There is something so completely natural about the gestur COLIN feels he has been swept back seven years in time an MARILYN is standing in front of him again, in the flesh. moves and delights him; perhaps he has never even really this clip before. At any rate he hasn't thought about it years. It is MARILYN as he will always remember her, relaxed, affectionate and vital, a part of her, however tiny, fore his. She smiles, laughs at something, giggles in delight (with sound). She says something to an unseen crew member, then looks back, smiling at the camera. MY WEEK WITH MARILYN 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face fills the screen. Beautiful, timeless - Happy. HOLD on the image for as long as we dare, then - FADE TO BLACK. THE END
